commitResults.messageTitle: Renamed main class and added greeting
added the add & list features that tracks userinput
added Task class-chabot can do marking/unmarking of tasks
update to include task type & override tostring in Task.java
added delete feature:it handles checked & indexOutofBound exceptions

commitResults.messageBody:
Can store userInput into hardisk for retrieval in new run.
This way userInput is persistent across usage.

Due date and time are now LocalDateTime objects
so that it is not treated simply as strings.

Thus can use formatting methods on the Date&Time.

Storage.java encapsulates the logic of writing and
reading hard-disk stored file.
Cupcake.java reflects the new class Storage.java.

TaskList.java encapsulates the logic of
commands executed on the list of tasks.

Parser class encapsulates the logic of
interpreting user's input on termainal.

Ui class encapsulates logic of system
printing statments and asking
for user input.

Updated the code to follow
suggested structure of constructor,
run method and one line in main.
Moved all the classes into duke.ui package

Package accidentaly given name duke.

But our main chatbot is Cupcake not Duke.

Rename duke packages to cupcake and
update package imports.

This maintains coherence and readability.
Check if typical minimal testcases pass.

commitResults.messageTitle: Add JavaDoc Header to all main classes

commitResults.messageBody:
Edited all main class java files to adhere
to coding standards to improve readability.

Find command: prints out all the tasks with
the user description.

commitResults.messageTitle: Update classes Ui, Parser, TaskList & Cupcake
commitResults.messageBody:
Find command: doesn't handle case where description not provided

This could throw error as obtaining description is hardcoded
based on substring index.

Let's add try-catch to handle decsription keyword
not being specified in Parser class.

This handles undesirable inputs for find command
elegantly and suggests how the user should
format the command.

Commands: Cannot type undesirable commands
like todo without description with trailing
or leading white space.

This breaks the Cupcake's main method.

Let's use trim() and strip() methods to check
if undesirable command is passed in.

Increases usability and convenience for users
as they can pass in undesirable command action
with spaces and it will be handled.

CLI: user runs program from Cupcake.java

Does not have user-friendly attractive GUI.

Let's use JavaFx to design a minimalistic GUI.

JavaFx is standard way to design GUI for java code.

No bundling of JavaFX with JAR file

The cupcake chatbot application will not
work on others' computer if they don't have
JavaFX set up.

Let's build a jar file using Gradle.

The chatbot can load on other devices
regardless of whether JavaFX is set-up.

Allows incomplete or invalid command inputs such as marking
invalid task number.

Since such a task number doesn't exist, the marking
won't be done but implicit assumption is valid input like
task number or complete task is passed.

Let's use assert statements to avoid array out
of bound errors and ensure our assumptions that
the index exists is assured.

Some methods have way more than 30 lines
of code.

Code readbility is poorer.

Let's refactor code using extract method and
apply DRY principles to make code more readable.

This adheres to SWE industry standards on coding
quality.
Add assert statements to cupcake.ui
Refactor ui package code

Users can add duplicate copies of the
exact same task.

The list will be flooded with the exact same tasks
due to multiple adds. Will be harder for user to
thus properly keep track of their tasks.

Let's add a detectDuplicates method to check if
the user's task description already exists. If it does,
don't re-add it and let user know.

Java HeaderDoc comments were missing for
a few methods.

HeaderDoc comments improve readability of code.

Let's add the necessary headerdoc comments
to adhere to industry standards.
Branch extension

The profile pictures have a white
background. The components do not
resize accordingly when window is resized.

For a more user friendly and aesthetic
interface, the gui requires minimal changes.

Let's use profile pictures whose background
matches the chatbot background. Lets set
Anchor values for the different chatbot fields
in MainWindow.fxml.

Using AnchorPane's Anchor attributes is a
standard way to edit gui when using fxml.

Readme is outdated and references Duke.

Readme is the introduction of my app
to someone who is not familiar with it
thus it must be the most updated version.

Let's edit the README.md to reflect the
latest changes and how the chatbot can be
run. Let's use chatgpt to supplement our
ideas and structure the README.md.

AI tools such as chatgpt complements
our project and writing a clear, concise
README is crucial to ensure product
understandability and Chatgpt is able to provide
good README documentations.

Booleans' naming does not follow the
naming standard.

For better code quality the naming
needs to change.

Let's identify boolean variables
and rename those which are not following
the naming convention.

This way the code is more readable and
variables are more intuitive to understand
for others.

Some exceptions are not handled such
as negative numbers or unexpected date
format.

While the GUI remains functional,
command line will abruptly exit program
when encountering these exceptions.

Let's add more robust try-catch and throw
exceptions so that we can handle exceptions
more gracefully.

We want our app to be as error-free as possible
for better user experience.

No user guide exists.

Users may be lost as to what features
are supported by the chatbot and how they
should run the commands.

Let's add a concise user guide listing
out how to run the different commands.

This is a standard documentation practice
beyond just the normal README.md which talks
about set up process.

The screenshot image references full path.

Full path is specific to my device and thus the
image will not be rendered properly.

Let's update the image path to use relative path.

This way, the image loads properly.

Jar file is outdated.

Need to update jar file so that
anyone can easily test the latest
version out.

Let's create a new gradle build
to reflect the changes.

The tasks added and modified are
saved for future use only if bye
command is used.

Perhaps, based on Task 7 instructions
and for better user functionality,
it is better to save the tasks as and when
even if 'bye' command is not used.

Let's add a method to write the tasks to
file in Storage.java and reference it in
Cupcake.java.

Thus, even if user accidnetally closes the
GUI without typing bye, the content is saved.

The jar file does not do saving of
tasks as and when but only if 'bye'
command is used.

The code has been updated so need to
reflect the change.

Let's rebuild the jar file.

The jar file now reflects the additional
functionality.

When user types bye command, the gui
window remains open and just prints back
a bye message.

The window should ideally close in response
to a bye command.

Let's add a system.exit(0) to run method.

This improves usability of the chatbot
as users need not manually close the chatbot
but can do so with a command.
